ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We have created all things in due measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We have indeed created all things by measure;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We have created everything in a determined measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We have created everything to fulfill a certain purpose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We have indeed created all things by a proper measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We have created all things with Qadar.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely We have created everything according to a measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely We have created everything in measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! We have created every thing by measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have created everything in due measure;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Veriiy everything! We have created it by a measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed We have created everything in a measure,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily, all things have We created in proportion and measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, We have created all things with Qadar (Divine Preordainments of all things before their creation, as written in the Book of Decrees Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, We have created all things according to a measure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Everything We created is precisely measured.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, all things We created with predestination.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:49] Truly everything (read inna kulla shay’in is [in the accusative as a] dependent clause because of a verb governing it) have We created in a measure, by ordainment (bi-qadarin, ‘in a measure’, is a circumstantial qualifier referring to kulla, ‘every’, in other words, ‘[already] predetermined’; a variant reading [for kulla] has [nominative] kullu as the subject, the predicate of which is khalaqnāhu, ‘We have created’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! We have created every thing) of your works (by measure) by you rejected this. This verse was revealed about those who argued about destiny.
